resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
github-actions[bot] commented on PR #14614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14614#issuecomment-1308510051

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

jorisvandenbossche commented on PR #14614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14614#issuecomment-1308587990

   Hmm, that doesn't seem to have helped. Looking back at the two logs I linked in the JIRA, also the setuptools version changed between those two (65.4.1 -> 65.5.0).

assignUser commented on PR #14614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14614#issuecomment-1308849182

   It looks like there is [an issue](https://github.com/apache/arrow/actions/runs/3428644826/jobs/5713204152#step:5:1436) with the naming schema of the `libarrow_dataset.<version>.dylib` : ` [411/465] Linking CXX shared library debug/libarrow_dataset.1100.0.0.dylib` vs `Library not loaded: '@rpath/libarrow_dataset.1100.dylib'`

raulcd commented on PR #14614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14614#issuecomment-1309054944

   @jorisvandenbossche @AlenkaF this is now failing on the cython test as it was before. Any idea around that? https://github.com/apache/arrow/actions/runs/3429883915/jobs/5716110145
   It also fails the cython test if we use Python 3.10 as seen on this run with the same issue: https://github.com/apache/arrow/actions/runs/3428990620/jobs/5714012255
   Should I set `PYARROW_TEST_CYTHON=OFF` temporarily and tackle this on a different PR?

jorisvandenbossche commented on PR #14614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14614#issuecomment-1309067682

   Yes, that's the expected failure again. Let's deal with that for a separate JIRA/PR.
   
   >  Should I set PYARROW_TEST_CYTHON=OFF temporarily and tackle this on a different PR?
   
   I am not sure if that env variable is actually still doing something. Maybe the easiest is to pass a flag to pytest to explicitly skip that one test (something like `-k "not test_cython_api"`)

jorisvandenbossche commented on PR #14614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14614#issuecomment-1309069106

   Although it _is_ curious why `PYARROW_BUNDLE_ARROW_CPP=ON` is needed only for Python 3.11 ...

raulcd commented on PR #14614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14614#issuecomment-1309105011

   > Although it _is_ curious why `PYARROW_BUNDLE_ARROW_CPP=ON` is needed only for Python 3.11 ...
   
   Agree, not sure why is necessary only for Python 3.11

ursabot commented on PR #14614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14614#issuecomment-1314505472

   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = cd61f81eafcb4d107e9b0b7548318513d4f4b3c3 and contender = 7a5f4c49f9353a5e88cca3eb0d445c24e22da9df. 7a5f4c49f9353a5e88cca3eb0d445c24e22da9df is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.
   Conbench compare runs links:
   [Finished :arrow_down:0.0% :arrow_up:0.0%] [ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/c9151e5ecd014b91bb8812de33c06f44...f94d36614c5144118de0e604dd90afe5/)
   [Failed :arrow_down:0.07% :arrow_up:0.0%] [test-mac-arm](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/f40248365804449e889e6892faf4ef2c...9668386e05b440e28a31ad14a120df31/)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

Removed file:///Users/runner/work/arrow/arrow/python from build tracker '/private/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T/pip-build-tracker-ib8gr4sw'

Error: Process completed with exit code 1. {code}
I have tested if the problem was related with Python3.11 to setup Python 3.10 on the job, see:
[https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14589]

but that's not the case so it requires more investigation.
fields.summary: [CI][Python] AMD64 macOS 11 Python 3 job fails on master on pip install

comments.body: [~jorisvandenbossche] [~alenka] Any idea what might be the cause for this failures? I will try and investigate

Not directly an idea. This build has been failing for some time (with a cython test failure) but it seems only recently started to fail with this installation issue.

From commits on master, 4 days ago test failure: https://github.com/apache/arrow/actions/runs/3363608185/jobs/5576970377
3 days ago installation failure: https://github.com/apache/arrow/actions/runs/3372998317/jobs/5597074003

A relevant difference is a pip 22.2.2 -> 22.3 update.
